alert.note: Alert for Davidson; Williamson (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 23 at 6:02PM CST until February 24 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Nashville has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Tennessee... Harpeth River At Bellevue affecting Williamson and Davidson Counties. For the Harpeth River...including Kingston Springs, Bellevue, Franklin, Franklin...elevated river levels are forecast. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Thursday afternoon at 1200 PM CST. && ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY, FEBRUARY 22 TO EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Harpeth River At Bellevue. * WHEN...From Tuesday, February 22 to early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, Portions of the Harpeth River Greenway may be covered with water and impassable, and the access road and the parking lot to the Harpeth River State Park are completely inundated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:30 PM CST Wednesday the stage was 16.3 feet and falling. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall to 5.6 feet early Monday afternoon. - Action stage is 14.0 feet. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
